content: Yes, it can be frustrating, and you're not alone in feeling that way. However, keep in mind that sometimes businesses may take time to implement changes that address customer feedback, or they may have certain constraints that limit their ability to make changes. But providing feedback helps businesses understand what their customers want and need, and ultimately helps them improve their product or service. So, while it may seem like feedback falls on deaf ears, it's still important to continue to provide it for the benefit of both the business and its customers.
